name: crisprseq-targeted
title: CRISPR Gene Editing Analysis
description: Comprehensive analysis pipeline for CRISPR gene editing experiments and pooled screens. Evaluates editing efficiency, specificity, and identifies significant hits in knockout/activation screens. Ideal for genome engineering validation and functional genomics discovery.
content:
ðŸ§¬ Overview

The CRISPR Gene Editing Analysis pipeline provides comprehensive analysis of CRISPR experiments, from single-gene edits to genome-wide screens. This workflow quantifies editing efficiency, identifies off-target effects, and discovers functionally important genes from pooled CRISPR screens.

ðŸ”§ Main Capabilities

This pipeline supports two distinct analysis modes:

  • Targeted Analysis: Evaluate gene editing quality for knockouts, knock-ins, base editing, and prime editing
  • Quality Metrics: Editing efficiency, indel profiles, HDR rates, and off-target analysis
  • Read Processing: Paired-end merging, UMI clustering, and adapter trimming
  • Edit Calling: Precise quantification of insertions, deletions, and substitutions
  • Screening Analysis: Identify essential genes from pooled knockout/activation screens
  • Statistical Analysis: MAGeCK/DESeq2 for robust hit identification

ðŸ“‹ Input Parameters

Samplesheet Format: Provide a CSV file with sample information following this structure:

For Targeted Analysis:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,reference,protospacer,template
control,control_R1.fastq.gz,control_R2.fastq.gz,reference.fa,ACTGTGAGCATGACTAGTGG,
edited,edited_R1.fastq.gz,edited_R2.fastq.gz,reference.fa,ACTGTGAGCATGACTAGTGG,template.fa
  • sample: Unique sample identifier
  • fastq_1/2: Paths to paired-end FASTQ files
  • reference: Reference sequence around target site
  • protospacer: 20bp guide RNA sequence (without PAM)
  • template: HDR template sequence (optional)

For Screening Analysis:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2
day0_rep1,day0_rep1_R1.fastq.gz,day0_rep1_R2.fastq.gz
day0_rep2,day0_rep2_R1.fastq.gz,day0_rep2_R2.fastq.gz
day21_rep1,day21_rep1_R1.fastq.gz,day21_rep1_R2.fastq.gz
day21_rep2,day21_rep2_R1.fastq.gz,day21_rep2_R2.fastq.gz

ðŸ’¡ Resource Optimization: For optimal resource consumption, the number of nodes should not be greater than the number of samples in your samplesheet.

ðŸ”¬ Scientific Relevance & Use Cases

This pipeline is essential for:

  • Gene Therapy Development: Validate therapeutic editing strategies and safety profiles
  • Functional Genomics: Discover essential genes and genetic interactions
  • Target Validation: Identify and validate drug targets through loss-of-function screens
  • Agricultural Biotechnology: Engineer crops with precise genetic modifications

The pipeline handles diverse CRISPR technologies including SpCas9, dCas9-activation, base editors, and prime editors, enabling comprehensive genome engineering applications.

ðŸ“Š Expected Outputs

  • Editing Efficiency Reports: Quantification of indels, HDR, and base conversions
  • Allele Frequency Tables: Detailed breakdown of editing outcomes
  • Quality Control Metrics: Read quality, mapping rates, and coverage statistics
  • Gene Ranking Tables: Significant hits from screening experiments
  • Visualization Plots: Editing patterns, screen volcano plots, and QC summaries

Built with Nextflow and the nf-core/crisprseq pipeline v2.3.0
